title: Mean vs Median in a Skewed Distribution: Buying Prices of Cars
question_text:
A graph (not shown) of the buying prices of cars at a local dealership reveals that the distribution is skewed to the right.
Which of the following statements below is TRUE?

choices.text: The median is the average of the $1\text{st}$ and $3\text{rd}$ quartiles.
The mean is less than the median.
The value of the $1\text{st}$ quartile minus the minimum is less than the maximum minus the $3\text{rd}$ quartile.
There are more buying prices between the $1\text{st}$ quartile and the median than there are between the median and $3\text{rd}$ quartile.
There are more buying prices that are greater than the mean than buying prices that are less than the mean.
